page.title: 01INTRODUCTION CALDERDALE
page.content: Old and new blend in this ancient cloth-manufacturing area. The main roads are all interlinked with old steep lanes and tarmaced over cobbled streets. The cloth trade made the area prosperous. The woollen mills got their power from the fast flowing rivers characteristic of this area, with nearby canals and railways for easy distribution. Nowadays the textile industry is not as dominant, and the canals are mainly used for leisure. New industries have built up around the old ones and towns have spread out to form better living conditions. Schools are mainly comprehensive but with some grammar. Calderdale is slowly changing from the satanic mill immage to a well planned township.
